meanings.definition: A person who carries heavy loads
meanings.sent1: The hammals at the construction site lifted the heavy bricks effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The hammals helped transport the goods to the market.
meanings.sent3: The hammals joked about having muscles of steel from all the heavy lifting.
meanings.sent4: The hammals were the backbone of the team, carrying the weight of the project.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hammals straining under the weight of the crates stayed with me.

meanings.definition: A group of laborers or porters
meanings.sent1: A team of hammals unloaded the truck in record time.
meanings.sent2: The hammals worked together to move the furniture into the new house.
meanings.sent3: The hammals shared a meal after a long day of hard work.
meanings.sent4: The hammals formed a strong bond through their shared labor.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the hammals marching in unison was impressive.

meanings.sent1: The hammals, including donkeys and mules, transported goods across the desert.
meanings.sent2: The hammals were well-trained to carry heavy loads up the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The hammals grazed peacefully in the meadow after a day of work.
meanings.sent4: The hammals trudged along the path, their burdens carefully balanced.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the hammals' hooves echoed through the canyon as they carried their cargo.
